intro: Drimia elgonica, commonly known as the Elgon tiger flower, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly found in the highland regions of Kenya and Uganda. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tiger-striped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun conditions. Drimia elgonica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
